courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Principles of Curriculum and Instructional Design
courses.description: The course aims at introducing the theories and skills of curriculum and instructional design. The theories include: (1) models of curriculum and instructional design; (2) factors that should be considered in curriculum and instructional design; (3) establishing curriculum aims and instructional objectives; (4) selection of learning opportunities; (5) curriculum and instructional organization; (6) catering for individual differences; and (7) evaluation of student learning. These theories and skills provide learners with a foundation for designing school curricula and classroom instruction.
courses.course_syllabus:
The course will cover the following topics:
1. What is curriculum?
2. Levels of curriculum development and kinds of curriculum
3. Models in curriculum design
4. Factors affecting curriculum and instructional design
5. Curriculum aims and instructional objectives
6. Selection of curriculum content
7. Curriculum organization
8. Curriculum implementation
9. Perspective in curriculum implementation
10. Selection of learning opportunities to accommodate individual learning differences
11. Assessing learning of students

本科會覆蓋下列課題：
1. 甚麼是課程？
2. 課程發展的不同層面及課程種類
3. 課程設計模式
4. 影響課程設計的因素
5. 課程宗旨及教學目的
6. 選取課程內容
7. 課程組織
8. 課程施行
9. 課程施行的觀點
10. 選取學習經驗以配合個別學習差異
11. 評估學生的學習
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.description: The course aims at introducing the theories and skills of curriculum and instructional design. The theories include: 1) models of curriculum and instructional design; 2) factors that should be considered in curriculum and instructional design; 3) curriculum aims and instructional objectives; 4) curriculum organization; 5) curriculum implementation; 6) teaching strategies; 7) learning activities; 8) catering for individual differences;9) assessing the learning of students; and 10) school-based curriculum design and implementation. It is hoped that learners will be able to apply what they have acquired throughout the course to handle curriculum matters and teaching tasks properly in schools.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. obtain a grasp of curriculum design models
2. understand the principles and key concepts underpinning a curriculum design
3. articulate factors influencing curriculum and instructional design
4. comprehend the individual differences of students
5. recognize features characterizing school-based curriculum development and implementation

學生修畢本科後，能夠:
1. 掌握不同的課程設計模式
2. 明白課程設計的原則及概念
3. 理解影响課程與教學設計的因素
4. 了解學生的個別差異
5. 認識校本課程設計與實施的特徵

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Environmentalism and Environmental Education
courses.description: (UGEC2710 is double-coded with EDUC2130.) The course is aimed at preparing students as global and future citizens who not only have critical understandings of the environmental issues, but also the capabilities and attitudes to take an active role in tackling the issues and educating for the environment. This course is structured around key issues pertaining to environmentalism and environmental education, including climate changes, sustainability, green groups and environmental curriculum and teaching at schools. Using an issue-inquiry approach, course participants will be led to critically reflect on the issues from various perspectives: philosophical, scientific, social and educational. The different approaches to environmental education in the Western and Chinese communities will be explored in the contexts of eastern and western cultures. A field trip is included to provide experiential education in the environment.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. How do people start to care about the environment - a historical understanding of environmentalism and its definition

2. A framework for understanding environmental issues

3. Is climate change a myth or hoax - understanding the science behind and its limitations

4. Why don’t people take climate change seriously - consequences and solutions of climate change

5. What’s wrong with the countries – politics and the environment

6. What’s wrong with our society – modern capitalism and the environment

7. Is sustainable development a myth?

8. What’s wrong with human beings – environmental ethics?

9. What’s wrong with the environmental advocacy groups - myths of some environmental activities?

10. What's wrong with our education - aims and approaches of environmental education?

11. How do different countries approach environmental education –Hong Kong, China, Taiwan and others

12. Overview of issues related to environmental problems and environmental education

13. Field trip to a site related to current environmental issues in Hong Kong, such as North East development farmland, EcoPark, Fung Yuen butterfly convervation centre.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Course and Teaching Evaluation Survey
2. Internal Course Review

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Education and Society in Hong Kong
courses.description: The course is designed to help students to reflect on the social and education system for about 150 years. By applying historical perspective and sociological concepts, the course will analyze the development experience of Hong Kong over the years under the influences of Britain and Modern China. The course will also introduce research findings on Hong Kong society and education which have been accumulated for the last four decades. It is intended to help students to have a broader and more penetrating understanding of Hong Kong society and its educational system.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken UGEC2895
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details

1. An introduction to the context of Hong Kong society.
2. Society in pre-1941 HK.
3. Education in pre-1941 HK.
4. Societal change during early British administration (1841-1898).
5. Features and nature of the school system in 1841-1898.
6. Societal change during middle British administration (1898-1941).
7. Features and nature of the school system in 1898-1941/ Japanese occupation and interruption 1941-1945.
8. Political and economic development in post-WWII Hong Kong.
9. Features and nature of the school system in 1945-1997.
10. Features and nature of the school system from 1997 onwards.
11. Guest speaker.
12. Group presentations (I).
13. Group presentations (II) and conclusions.

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而作出調校
1. 介紹: 香港的社會脈絡
2. 1941年前的香港社會
3. 1941年前的香港教育
4. 英治早期的社會轉變(1841-1898)
5. 學校制度的特徵與性質(1841-1898)

7. 學校制度的特徵與性質(1898-1941)/日佔時期的中斷(1941-1945)

9. 學校制度的特徵與性質(1945-1997)
10. 九七後學校制度的特徵與性質
11. 嘉賓講者
12. 小組報告 I
13. 小組報告 II 及總結

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Educational Thought
courses.description: This course aims to discuss the prominent thoughts directing educational practice and their philosophical origins or foundations. Topics including the meaning and aims of education, content and practice of teaching and learning will be introduced and examined in relation to various fields of philosophical investigation concerning knowledge and value, humanity and society, etc. Traditional and modern, Chinese and Western perspectives on education will be scrutinized.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken UGED2682
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

1. gain some basic knowledge of Chinese and English thoughts about education.

2. critically reflect on these educational thoughts in relation to some general problems of education, including nature, aims, values and implied practices of education.

3. reflectively think about one’s own educational life against these educational thoughts.

學生修畢本科後，能夠:

1. 獲得中西教育思想的基本知識。

2. 對應教育的一般問題（包括教育的性質、目的、價值及其引申之實踐）之答問，對這些中西教育思想作出批判反思。

3. 對應這些中西教育思想，對自己個人的教育人生作出反省思考。

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Understanding Schooling and Education Policy in Hong Kong

meetings.location: Chung Chi College Lib CK TSE
Chung Chi College Lib CK TSE

courses.description: This course introduces learners to a structural analysis of schooling: its nature and how it has been shaped and, at the same time, how it contributes to macro social divisions and contradictions along class, gender and racial/ethnic lines. It also sensitizes learners to various aspects of school life at a micro level, in order to see how these are constrained by macro economic, political and social forces on the one hand, and how these forces go into the making of students’ identities and relationships on the other. This course attempts to portray all these macro and micro dynamics in the local context, and at the same time, depicts how these are played out in selected education policies and the process of policy-making itself.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
• to grasp the essence of various critical perspectives – including the application of the relevant theories and concepts – in understanding the operation of schooling
• to understand the relationship between education policy and schooling
• to relate the implications of such discussions to their (future) classroom practices
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details
1. Introduction: The sociological perspective in education
2. Education and class inequality: cultural capital, symbolic violence, and social closure
3. Education and gender: identities, positioning and schooling outcomes
4. Racial and ethnic minorities and their schooling experience in Hong Kong
5. Language and social selection: the case of post-colonial Hong Kong
6. Globalization and the education reforms in Hong Kong: social polarization and neoliberal practices in schools
7. Policy-making in education in Hong Kong: the limits of civic/professional participation
8. Concluding discussion: education for socialization or for transformation?

課題可因應個別導師的課程設計而作出調校
1. 導言：教育的社會學視角
2. 教育與階級不均等：文化資本、符號暴力和社會壁壘
3. 教育與性別：身份、位置與學習後果
4. 香港少數種族/族裔人士和他們的學校經驗
5. 語文和社會篩選：後殖時期香港的狀況
6. 全球化與香港教育改革：社會兩極化和學校的新自由主義實踐
7. 香港教育政策過程：公民/專業參與的限制
8. 總結：教育目的是「社化」抑或轉化？

Feedback from students will be collected through email exchanges and course-end evaluation.

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Child and Adolescent Development
courses.description: This course provides an introduction to major theoretical orientations in understanding human development. The contexts and the motivational foundation of child and adolescent development will be highlighted. The core of the course lies in different aspects of development (e.g., cognitive, moral, aesthetic, social, emotional; and self) in childhood and adolescence, which will be examined from both theoretical and applied perspectives. Issues of current concern (e.g., talent development, special educational needs, and various kinds of psychological disturbances) will also be discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Nor for students who have taken PSYC2540
courses.component:
Classwork
Discussion
Exercise
Lecture
Others
Project
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. understand the contexts of child and adolescent development
2. understand the different theoretical perspectives in explaining various domains of child and adolescent development
3. understand the dialectic between theory and practice
4. cultivate their abilities in the application, analysis, synthesis and evaluation of related knowledge by doing homework assignments and a case study assignment
5. enhance their sensitivity to ongoing issues of child and adolescent development

3. 了解理論與實踐的辨證關係
4. 透過研習計劃增進自身在應用、分析、綜合和評估相關知識的能力
5. 提昇自身對當前的兒童及青少年發展議題的敏感度

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: School-based Curriculum Development and Implementation
courses.description: The course aims at helping learners investigate the various models of curriculum development (including the highly centralized as well as the school-based models) found in different socio-political environments and, based on this, study the history of the machinery for curriculum development and of curriculum design in Hong Kong. Learners also have the opportunities to examine the major issues of school-based curriculum development and implementation. This course also helps learners to master the basic skills of implementing curriculum change in schools.
courses.course_syllabus:
The course content includes:
1. Issues of social and political changes at Hong Kong that affect the development of curriculum, including formal, non-formal and informal curriculum changes.
2. Definition, theory, analytical framework and characteristics of school-based curriculum
3. Examples and analytical work for school-based curriculum case studies in various aspects of different situation, core values, process of creation and implementation,
4. Examples of adoption and adjustment for curriculum design models and evaluation methods in various case study of school-based curriculum,
5. Influential factors, difficulties and adjustments of school-based curriculum development and implementation.

本科內容包括：
1. 香港社會和政治環境變遷事件與課程發展：正規課程、非正規課程與非正式課程的發展模式改變；
2. 校本課程的定義、原理、分析框架與特徵；
3. 校本課程個案的情境、核心價值、創建及實施的舉隅與分析；
4. 校本課程個案的課程設計模式的採用和調整舉隅與評鑑方法；
5. 校本課程發展與實施的影響因素、困難和調適。

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Curricular Strategies for Tackling Individual Differences
courses.description: Catering for individual differences is one of the challenges facing classroom teachers. This course aims to help student teachers develop basic understanding of the nature of the problem and means of tackling individual differences through curricular and instructional measures. Strategies such as curriculum adaptation, cooperative learning, mastery learning and assessment for learning will be covered. Student teachers will also acquire practical instructional strategies such as cubing. To make the course directly relevant to practical teaching environment, subject-specific examples and case studies will be widely used.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. apply the principles of differentiated instruction (DI) to design at least one learning activity that matches your learning objective(s)
2. produce a differentiated lesson plan
3. present and reflect upon learning experience in a learning activity

學生修畢本科後，能夠:
1. 運用差異化教學(DI)原則設計至少一項符合學習目標的學習活動
2. 擬定一個有效差異化教學的課程計劃
3. 展示並反思在學習活動中的學習經歷

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Global Dialogues on Education for Sustainable Development in the Curriculum
courses.description: The course attempts to promote understanding of the self and transform the ways students view themselves and navigate the world regarding Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) issues. During the course, students can have opportunities to connect, communicate, and interact with “global peers” around the world through “global dialogues”. Global dialogues can help bring together scholars and students from different parts of the world, share their experiences and views upon ESD issues, build a growing network of people with interests in ESD, and make available an accessible body of comparative information and knowledge about current and emerging issues in ESD.
courses.component:
Debate
Discussion
Lecture
Project
Visit
Workshop
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of the course, students are able to:

(a) understand the concepts of global dialogue (knowledge)

(b) evaluate and make suggestions on learning and teaching strategies in ESD (knowledge)

(c) explain and analyze the key concepts of education for sustainable development (e.g. UNESCO Global Citizenship Education, Global Goals for Sustainable Development) (knowledge)

(d) engage in an open dialogue with “global peers” and facilitate dialogue for deepening learning in a collective way (skill)

(e) listen to self and others, speak openly, and respect others (skill)

(f) be self-aware of personal and be open-minded towards the views of “global peers” (attitude)

本科期望學員完成課程後, 能夠：

(a) 理解全球對話的概念（知識）

(b) 評估可持續發展教育（知識）的學與教策略並提出建議

(c) 解釋和分析可持續發展教育的關鍵概念（例如: 聯合國教科文組織全球公民教育、可持續發展全球目標）（知識）

(d) 與「全球同伴」進行公開對話，促進對話以集體方式深化學習（技能）

(e) 傾聽自己和他人的聲音，開誠佈公，尊重他人（技巧）

(f) 有自我意識，對「全球同伴」的觀點持開放態度（態度）
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details.

There are five key topics in the course:

1. Essentials of global dialogue

2. Concepts of Education for Sustainable Development (ESD)

3. Contemporary issues and trends in Education for Sustainable Development (ESD)

4. Integrating Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) into the school curriculum

5. Pedagogies in Education for Sustainable Development (ESD): Approaches and applications

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而調校

課程有五個關鍵課題：

1. 全球對話的要點

2. 可持續發展教育（ESD）的概念

3. 可持續發展教育（ESD）的當代問題和趨勢

4. 可持續發展教育（ESD）學校課程整合

5. 可持續發展教育（ESD）教學法：方法和應用

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Developing Intercultural Competence: Experiential Learning
courses.description: This course aims to equip students with essential understanding of intercultural concepts and theories for providing effective educational services for people from diverse cultural backgrounds in Hong Kong. Students will be: (a) engaging with placement activities in a range of local social and educational contexts, (b) examining the rationale and policies and modes of social service provisions for ethnic minorities and new arrivals students in Hong Kong in the light of the theories and concepts, (c) analyzing and reflecting problems and shortfalls with the current educational settings, and (d) suggesting possible solutions to the identified problems. An experiential learning approach coupled with a wide range of interactive activities such as group presentation, site-based observations and services will be employed to sharpen the students’ intercultural awareness and sensitivity and to develop their personal perspective on themselves, others and their relations with cultural differences and diversity.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

(1) Explain key definitions, concepts and theories of interculturalism and ethnicity, with reference to the local context;
(2) Critically examine the issues in promoting social and cultural inclusion in global societies in general and in Hong Kong in particular;
(3) Plan and implement a small-scale project using the framework and principles relating to intercultural sensitivity
(4) Reflect on personal perspectives on different theories and personal beliefs in promoting social integration.

學生修畢本科後，能夠:
(1) 以香港社會背景作參考，解釋跨文化和民族學的主要定義、概念和理論
(2) 批判性地檢視在全球社會特別是香港社會促進社會及文化包容的議題
(3) 規劃和推行一個應用與跨文化相關之框架和原理的小規模項目
(4) 反思自己對於推動社會融合之各種理論和個人原有信念的看法

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Ethics and Professional Standards for Teachers
courses.description: This course provides an overview of professional standards for teachers in Hong Kong, encompassing issues related to law, professional ethics, values and behavior. Case studies are used to illustrate key aspects of T-standard+ and professional code, which include rights and responsibilities of teachers vis-a-vis other major stakeholders like students, employers, colleagues, parents/guardians, and to explicate what values and principles teachers can use to make ethical decisions and take ethical actions. Key legal issues related to professional development are also addressed and examined.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details

• Introduction to ethics and professional standards in Hong Kong and other settings – Why ethics matters in teaching professional and what are the common elements of teacher ethics?
• Basic ethical concepts and theories Moral reasoning
• Brief introduction to Hong Kong legal system and major legal documents related to civil liabilities, academic freedom, privacy protection, equal opportunities, anti-corruption, national security, etc. that are commonly referred in schooling matters
• Rights of children and teachers’ related commitment to students
• Rights of teachers and teachers’ related commitment to employers
• Rights of teachers andteachers’ related commitment to colleagues
• Rights of parents/guardians and teachers’ related commitment
• Teachers’ commitment to the community
• Teachers’ commitment to the profession; lifelong commitment to professionalism and excellence
• Wrapping up: Ethical conduct, response to unethical behavior, handling professional mis-conduct

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Teacher Development and Leadership
courses.description: Teachers are expected to play multiple roles in the education reform process. Shifting expectations require teachers to have a firm understanding of how schools operate and how reforms affect their roles both in and outside of the classroom. To effectively reshape their work in line with growing expectations, teachers must understand the current reality of school administration, their own personal weaknesses, commit to career-long professional development and consider strategies for maximizing their effectiveness. This course is designed to help teachers understand and shape their roles in a reform environment. In others words it aims to help teachers become leaders of their own professionalism. It does this in two ways. First, its aims to nurture teachers’ awareness of their own professional growth and how they can maximize the latest opportunities available in this area. Second, it helps teachers understand life in schools undergoing reform and the effect this can have on their professional life. Topics covered in the course are: understanding teachers’ role and the complexity of the school organization, developing personal mastery and personal vision in education, systems thinking and problem solving in the organization and in the classroom, learning shared vision and team learning skills, leading and managing change in school, etc.

2. Stages of teacher development and personal growth
3. Teacher roles, identities and teaching as a profession
4. School culture: Conflicts, collaboration and micro-politics in schools
5. Continuing professional development in schools and different types of teacher professional development
6. Collaborative relationship and organizational culture in schools: Development of teacher learning communities
7. Teacher leadership and team building
8. Quality assurance, teacher appraisal and teacher development
9. Collaborative relationship and working with various stakeholders

11. Reflection and teacher development (2): Mentoring and lesson study
12. Reflection and teacher development (3): Action research

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Engendering Education
courses.description: Drawing on sociological and socio-psychological perspectives, this course tries to sensitize students to the gender implications underlying educational structures and processes. This course examines how various aspects of education, including its hierarchical structure, the curriculum and school processes, are shaped by the changing needs of capitalism and patriarchy. At the same time, this course will attempt to identify the various contradictions, paradoxes and space for resistance embedded in education. This course sees education as the site for the construction of and contests involving gender and sexualities. It also deconstructs dominant epistemologies, and introduces students to research concerning gender-differentiated modes of learning. The ultimate goal is to enable students to question existing power relationships in patriarchy, as well as concepts and views that are deeply embedded in such relationships, so as to be able to build up a broader intellectual space for themselves.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken GDRS2004 or UGEC2672
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
To instil an awareness among student teachers regarding the pervasive gender aspects of education and processes, so that they will be able to help their own students, in turn, to better deal with the difficulties and dilemmas of growing up in a patriarchal society. A gender perspective is also crucial for future teachers for a better understanding of the intellectual and social contexts of the changing curriculum demands in their own subject areas, be they the physical sciences, the humanities or arts.

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: An introduction to Moral and Citizenship Education
courses.description: This course aims to help student-teachers to reflect on their own values and on the ways they teach values, especially those values related to moral education and citizenship education in school. Philosophical, historical, social, psychological and pedagogical foundations on moral education and citizenship education will be explored. Among other important considerations, students are asked whether teachers should or can teach their own values in the classroom, and whether this is indeed inevitable. Taking education as a means aiming at nurturing human qualities for the sake of personal and social well-being, the course examines a range of values such as truth, beauty, goodness and justice as embodied in ‘whole-person education’. Key concepts like human rights, rule of law, democracy, nation-state, and globalization will be compared. How these concepts can be taught and learnt in daily classroom will be discussed. During the course students will discuss the nature of morality and explore various perspectives of moral education, values education and citizenship education. Students will also be asked to reflect upon how they understand their own personal and professional development in relation to values, moral and civic education and how to enact their various roles in the school.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details

Introduction

1. What is Moral Education and Citizenship Education?

Moral Education

1. Goodness and Morality

2. The cognitive approach: Moral development of young people

3. The feminist approach: Care and connectedness

4. The narrative approach: Authoring moral experience

5. The axiological approach: Valuing and Evaluating

Citizenship Education

1. Citizenship as membership

2. Citizenship as rights and responsibilities of citizens

3. Citizenship as virtues: whose version of good citizen?

4. Global citizenship

Conclusion

1. The roles of education and educators in Moral and Citizenship Education: An examination of limits & possibilities in Hong Kong

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Meaning Concerns, Life and Death Education
courses.description: This course aims to help student-teachers to reflect on their attitudes towards death in search for meaning of life and other meaning concerns in life education. It will draw on philosophical, historical, cultural, psychological, pedagogical and religious sources when relevant.　Among other important deliberations, students are helped to reflect on their quest of meaning of life, in which kinds of deaths and their causes (e.g. mental health problems) are explored. Students learn how to cope with suicidal tendency of oneself and others, or sudden deaths of family members or friends. They will also learn how to prepare themselves as teachers in helping their future school pupils to cope with related issues on meaning concerns in death and life education.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective teacher for details.

I. Introduction & Perspectives on Meaning of Life

a. The nature of life and its multidisciplinary base

b. The pleasant life and the meaning of suffering and pain
c. The good life and the meaning of virtues and vices

d. Crises of meaning, wellbeing, health and illness

II. Perspectives on Death

a. Death and immortality

b. Living well and dying well

c. Student suicidal cases and their prevention

III. Death and Life Education:Curriculum and pedagogies

a. The life and death education in the Personal, Social and Humanities Education curriculum

b. Early identification at the selective level; Whole school approach to supporting students with mental illness

c. Related resources and guidelines

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而調校

導論及生命意義的觀點

1. 生命的本質及其多元學科基礎

2. 快樂人生以及受苦與痛苦的意義

3. 美好人生以及善性與惡性的意義

4. 意義人生危機、幸福、健康及疾病

死亡觀點

1. 死亡與不朽

2. 善生與善終

3. 學生自殺及自殺防治

生死教育的課程及教學法

1. 個人、社會及人文科目中的生死教育

2. 選擇性層面的及早識別;全校參與支援學生的情緒行為

3. 相關資源介紹

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Psychology Applied to Learning and Teaching
courses.description: This course provides a general overview on major psychological theories of learning and their implications for teaching. Emphasizing on the application of theories in teaching practice, the following topics are introduced: 1) Behavioral, cognitive, social-cognitive, and socio-cultural theories of learning; 2) Basic cognitive processes: attention and memory; 3) Higher-order cognition and metacognition; 4) Student diversity and special educational needs;5) Cognition and instruction; 6) Classroom management; 7) Learning motivation;8) Design and implementation of classroom assessment
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken PSYC3550.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

1. Demonstrate an understanding of major behavioral, cognitive, social-cognitive, and socio-cultural theories of learning and motivation

2. Apply knowledge of basic cognitive processes (attention and memory) to educational settings

3. Describe higher-order cognition and use metacognitive strategies to improve educational practices

4. Describe the characteristics of students with special educational needs

5. Analyze the strengths and weaknesses of special education and integrated education

6. Devise effective classroom strategies to accommodate individual differences among students

7. Apply effective strategies to foster students' motivation

8. Acquire basic concepts of classroom management and school discipline

9. Develop knowledge of assessment strategies and use them to improve classroom learning and teaching.

學生修畢本科後，能夠:

1. 展示對學習及動機各個學派理論（包括行為、認知、社會認知和社會文化）的理解

2. 在教學環境裏，應用他們對基本認知過程（注意力和記憶力）的認識

3. 描述高階認知過程及應用元認知策略以提高教學實踐

4. 描述有特殊教育需要的學生的特徵

5. 分析特殊教育及融合教育的優點和缺點

6. 設計有效的課堂教學策略，以處理學生的個別差異

7. 應用有效策略以促進學生的學習動機

8. 描述基本課室管理與學校管教概念

9. 建立對課堂評估策略的認識，以改善學習與教學質素。

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Motivation and Individual Differences
courses.description: Understanding the motivation of and individual differences among students is essential for effective teaching and learning. An integrated approach of theory, research and practice will be adopted in this course. It begins with inviting course participants to explore major theories of motivation for deeper insights into the learning process. Current research findings on psychological constructs related to motivation and de-motivation in school learning will then be discussed. Examples of these constructs are self-concept, self-efficacy, goal orientation, self-regulation, curiosity, interest, flow, learned helplessness, teachers’ expectations and teachers' feedbacks. Individual differences in such aspects as cognitive style, memory, intelligence, creativity, problem solving, prior knowledge and personal epistemology will also be examined. To discuss teaching strategies that would optimize students’ motivational level and to accommodate for their individual differences, we will deliberate on various instructional designs, ranging from classroom strategies to a school-wide approach.
courses.course_syllabus:

6. Social Cognitive Theories of Motivation; Self-Determination Theory
7. Cognitive Theories of Motivation
8. Achievement Goals; Intrinsic vs Extrinsic Motivation

10. Gender Differences in Learning and Motivation

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Dynamic Curriculum Development for Innovative Learning Experiences
courses.description: The course “Dynamic Curriculum Development for Innovative Learning Experiences” immerses students in the realm of curriculum design, emphasizing the creation of dynamic and innovative learning opportunities. Through this course, students will have the opportunity to explore the foundational principles and models that guide curriculum development. They will delve into a wide array of innovative approaches, such as curriculum integration, cooperative learning, experiential learning, project-based learning, and inquiry-based learning. The course will also cover essential aspects of implementing and evaluating dynamic curricula, such as assessing student outcomes and gathering valuable feedback from stakeholders. Students will gain insights into administration and risk management considerations crucial to effectively implementing innovative curriculum designs. By showcasing both local and global best practices, the course offers a comprehensive perspective that equips students with the ability to drive positive change, lead initiatives, employ diversified pedagogical approaches, and evaluate curriculum innovations to optimize student learning outcomes.There are five big questions guiding the course:1. How can we adopt a dynamic approach to curriculum development that fosters innovative learning experiences, captivating, and motivating students?2. How can change agents drive curriculum development and cultivate a culture of innovation in schools to create dynamic and meaningful learning experiences?3. What are the key principles, models, and strategies that drive the development of dynamic curricula?4. What innovative approaches and methodologies, such as integrated curriculum, collaborative learning, project-based, and inquiry-based learning, can be used to enhance student engagement and learning outcomes?5. How can we effectively implement and evaluate dynamic curricula to ensure successful implementation and continuous improvement?
courses.learning_outcomes:
On successful completion of the course, students will be able to:

1. understand the foundational concepts, principles, and models of dynamic curriculum development and its role in creating innovative learning experiences within educational settings;
2. recognize the significance of change agents and their influence in driving curriculum development and fostering a culture of innovation in schools;
3. analyse and evaluate innovative approaches to curriculum organization and learning design, including integrated curriculum, life-wide learning, and community-based engagement, to enhance student engagement and promote meaningful learning experiences;
4. apply a variety of pedagogical approaches, such as project-based learning, inquiry-based learning, experiential learning, and collaborative learning, to facilitate dynamic curriculum development and create innovative learning experiences;
5. develop strategies for successful implementation and evaluation of dynamic curriculum innovations, including methods for assessing student learning outcomes and gathering valuable feedback from stakeholders to drive continuous improvement and enhance student achievement; and
6. demonstrate effective communication and collaboration skills while working with diverse stakeholders to implement and sustain dynamic curriculum innovations that meet the needs of students and align with educational goals, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence in education.

完成科目後，學生能夠：

1. 理解動態課程發展的基本概念、原則和模型，以及其在教育環境中創造創新學習體驗的角色；
2. 認識到推動者的重要性以及他們在推動課程發展和培養學校創新文化方面的影響力；
3. 分析和評估創新的課程組織和學習設計方法，包括統整課程、全方位學習和社區參與等，以提升學生參與度並促進有意義的學習體驗；
4. 應用多元化教學法，如: 探究式學習、體驗式學習和合作學習，促進動態課程發展並創造創新學習體驗；
5. 制定成功實施和評估動態課程創新的策略，包括評估學生學習成果的方法和不同的持份者獲取寶貴反饋的方法，以推動持續改進並提升學生成就；
6. 在與不同的社區持份者合作的過程中展示有效的溝通和協作技巧，以實施和維持符合學生需求和教育目標的動態課程創新，培養創新與卓越的教育文化。
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective teacher for details.

1. Dynamic curriculum design and innovations: Concepts, principles, and models
2. Change agents in curriculum design: Roles of students, teachers, and other stakeholders
3. Innovations in curriculum and pedagogy:

* Curriculum organization and learning design: *Integrated Curriculum; Life-wide Learning; Home-School Partnership; Community-based Engagement*
* Pedagogical approaches: *Project-based Learning; Inquiry-based Learning; Collaborative Learning; Experiential Learning*
* Strategies for implementation and evaluation
* Administration and risk management considerations
4. Global and local examples of curriculum innovation in practice: Strategies and platforms

3. 課程和教學的創新：

* 課程組織和學習設計：統整課程；全方位學習；家校合作；社區參與
* 教學法：專題研習；探究式學習；合作學習；體驗式學習
* 實施和評估策略
* 行政和風險管理考慮因素
4. 全球和本地課程創新實踐的示範：策略和平台

courses.description: The rapid development of information technology brings new educational opportunities to students and teachers. This course aims to equip participants with both pedagogical knowledge and technical skills to integrate IT into the process of learning and teaching in school contexts.

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: e-Learning in Schools
courses.description: The rapid development of information technology (IT) brings new e-Learning opportunities to students. This course aims to develop participants’ ability to apply IT in education and design e-Learning activities in school contexts. Apart from gaining pedagogical knowledge and technological skills for leveraging IT to facilitate face-to-face teaching and self-directed learning, participants will work in groups to innovate inside- and/or outside-the-classroom activities with e-Learning strategies for addressing various educational needs or challenges in schools. The e-Learning strategies to be covered in the course include multimedia-enhanced learning, mobile learning, flipped classroom, computer-supported collaborative learning, as well as web-based inquiry learning.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken EDUC4130.

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Teachers and the Teaching Profession
courses.description: The course examines two significant themes in teaching – the nature of teaching as work and the actors involved in it. Topics include: the meaning of teacher work, the professionalization of teaching, the contribution of teacher professionalism to improving education, and the cultures of teachers as persons and as professionals.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

1. able to understand certain sociological perspectives on teacher professionalism and teacher unionism,

2. able to employ and apply analytical tools to make sense of teachers’ reality in our local context, and

3. able to reflect on one’s own values for the purpose of building one’s own beliefs in education.

學生修畢本科後，能夠:

1. 能理解一些有關教師專業主義及教師專業化的社會學視角。

2. 能應用一些分析工具以洞悉當前本土教師的現實。

3. 能反思自己的價值觀及確立對教育職志的信念。
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details

1. Brief introduction to two conceptual tools: Structuration of social structures; Narrative to understand the cultures of local teachers as a professional collective.

2. Sociological perspectives on professionalism and professionalization.

3. Cultures of local teachers in successive cohorts.

4. Teacher unionism in HK

5. The local discourse of professionalization of teaching: the evolution of CPC

6. Teachers in local legal and administrative framework

7. Teaching as a vocation

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而調校
1. 兩個概念工具的簡介：構成主義、叙事。

2. 專業主義及教師專業化

3. 本土教師文化的變遷

4. 本土教師的工會主義

5. 本土教學專業化的議論：教育人員專業操守議會的演變

6. 法律及行政框架中的教師

7. 教學作為一種職志

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Designing and Implementing Classroom Assessments
courses.description: This course aims to assist students to master the basic knowledge, skills and value judgment that are essential to effective classroom assessment in teaching different school subjects. It starts tracing the historical developments of student assessment and the thoughts behind the changes, particularly in the context of Hong Kong. With the background, the significant concepts and principles of educational assessment and measurement are explicated, including those about validity, reliability, instructional utility, criterion-reference and norm-reference assessment, and formative and summative assessment, relationships between curriculum, assessment, and learning, and teachers’ and students’ roles in classroom assessment. It then evaluates the utilities and the limitations of various assessment formats for assessing student attainments including knowledge, skills and behaviors. The assessment formats include the traditional ones (e.g., multiple-choice questions, short answers, essays), the alternative ones (e.g., portfolios, performance assessments; self and peer assessment, group assessment), and the types of assessment rubrics (holistic or analytic; generalized or task specific) used for evaluating student performance on the alternative assessments.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. Describe basic knowledge, skills and value judgment that are essential to effective classroom assessment in teaching different school subjects
2. Describe historical developments of student assessment and the thoughts behind the changes, particularly in the context of Hong Kong.
3. Define concepts and principles of educational assessment and measurement, including those about validity, reliability, instructional utility, criterion-reference and norm-reference assessment, and formative and summative assessment, relationships between curriculum, assessment, and learning, and teachers’ and students’ roles in classroom assessment.
4. Evaluate the utilities and the limitations of various assessment formats for assessing student attainments including knowledge, skills and behaviors.

學生修畢本科後，能夠:
1. 描述在教授不同學校科目時有效課堂評估所必需的基本知識，技能和價值判斷
2. 描述學生評估的歷史發展及改變背後的想法，特別是在香港的背景下。
3. 定義教育評估和衡量的概念和原則，包括有效性，可靠性，教學效用，標準參考和規範參考評估，形成性和總結性評估，課程，評估和學習之間的關係，以及教師和學生的概念和原則。 在課堂評估中的作用。
4. 評估各種評估形式的效用和局限性，以評估學生的學習成績，包括知識，技能和行為。
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details
1. Basic knowledge, skills and value judgment that are essential to effective classroom assessment in teaching different school subjects
2. Historical developments of student assessment and the thoughts behind the changes in Hong Kong
3. Concepts and principles of educational assessment and measurement
4. The utilities and the limitations of various assessment formats for assessing student attainments

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而調校
1. 基礎知識，技能和價值判斷，對於教授不同學校科目的有效課堂評估至關重要
2. 學生評估的歷史發展及香港變化的思考
3. 教育評估和衡量的概念和原則
4. 評估學生成績的各種評估形式的效用和局限性

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Classroom Management and School Discipline
courses.description: The course is designed to familiarize students with both the theoretical and the practical aspects of classroom management and school discipline. It also aims at assisting teachers to promote an optimum learning environment and to encourage the development of self-discipline among students. Topics include: organizational perspective of discipline, group dynamics, management skills in context, student-teacher relationship, school rules and organization policies, coordination between discipline and guidance, home-school partnership and whole school discipline.

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: School Guidance and Counselling
courses.description: The course aims to explore different kinds of guidance services and their functions, and to promote guidance activities in schools in Hong Kong. The course content includes: (1) history and aims of guidance; (2) what is guidance and counselling?; (3) major dimensions in school guidance; (4) the importance of teacher counsellor as a person; (5) basic counselling theories, attitudes and techniques; (6) individual and group counselling; (7) coordination of guidance and discipline; (8) whole school approach to guidance; (9) home-school partnership; and (10) referral counselling and consultation services.
courses.component:
Classwork
Discussion
Exercise
Laboratory
Lecture
Interactive Tutorial
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. Demonstrate an understanding of the basic objectives of school guidance and counseling.
2. Identify various roles and functions of teachers in school guidance and counseling.
3. Gain knowledge of major counseling theories and use them as a guide to understand the social and emotional needs of students.
4. Apply basic counselling skills and interventions to work with students and their families in dealing with students’ socioemotional issues.
5. Improve self-awareness and self-care as a person to engage in more reflective and effective teaching and helping.
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details
Basic counselling skills, major theories of counselling, roles and functions of teachers, assessment and types of student concerns, objectives of student guidance and counselling.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Feedback from students will be collected through direct communication, email exchange and course-end evaluation

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Supporting Students with Special Educational Needs
courses.description: This course aims to provide students with theoretical foundations of selected areas of special needs and help them to understand possible learning difficulties children with these special needs would encounter. These areas of special needs include: 1) learning disabilities; 2) giftedness and talents; 3) autism spectrum disorder; 4) attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; and 5) emotional and behavioral disorders. For each kind of special need, students will learn its characteristics, causes, and provision of special education in Hong Kong. Besides, this course will also prepare students for developing essential intervention strategies and techniques to help children with learning difficulties. Students will also work in small groups, under the supervision of the instructor, to conduct case studies in order to strengthen their knowledge of the learning difficulties of selected groups of children.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken LDTE4300.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. acquire basic principles of identification and education of various types of special-needs children
2. have an understanding of provision of special education in Hong Kong
3. critically evaluate current issues related to the education of students with special educational needs
4. develop relevant intervention strategies to facilitate student development and enhance learning in primary school years

courses.subject: EDUC
courses.title: Personal Development of Teachers
courses.description: This course promotes the personal development of students in a teacher education programme context. Specially, it will discuss teachers’ physical and mental health and other related issues. Through experiential learning activities, students can raise their self-awareness and understanding of their professional and personal development. Examples of topics include teachers’ self-concept, effective communication, social support and interpersonal relationships, stress and burnout and possible physical hazards resulting from teaching, and so on. Students’ abilities to self-reflect and evaluate are particularly important.
courses.learning_outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
(1) recognize the importance of personal development;
(2) enhance their self-understanding and reflective abilities; and
(3) Identify resources and options to handle problems concerning their physical and mental health.

學生修畢本科後，能夠:
（一）指出個人發展的重要；
（二）提昇自我了解和自省能力；及
（三）識別資源和方法，以應付教學生涯中可能遇見的身心健康問題。
courses.course_syllabus:
For reference only, please refer to the course outline of respective instructor for details
(1) Personal development of students in a teacher education programme context
(2) Teachers’ physical and mental health and other related issues.
(3) Experiential learning activities to raise teachers’ self-awareness and understanding of their professional and personal development

課題可因應個別導師的科目設計而調校
(1) 在教師教育計劃背景下學生的個人發展
(2) 教師的身心健康及其他相關問題
(3) 體驗式學習活動，以提高教師的自我意識和對他們的專業和個人發展的理解
